brewers_tips: Ferment at a cool temperature to enhance the hoppy aroma.
description: A light and refreshing pale ale with a citrusy hop character.
name: Cascade Citrus

brewers_tips: Use a strong yeast strain to ensure complete fermentation of the high gravity wort.
description: A rich and complex imperial stout with notes of chocolate, coffee, and roasted barley.
name: Nightfall Imperial Stout

brewers_tips: Experiment with different fruits for a unique flavor profile.
description: A tart and refreshing wheat beer infused with real strawberries.
name: Summer Strawberry Wheat

brewers_tips: Dry hop generously for maximum aroma and flavor.
description: A juicy and flavorful New England IPA with notes of citrus, mango, and pine.
name: Tropical Haze IPA

brewers_tips: Use a traditional German lager yeast for an authentic flavor profile.
description: A crisp and clean pilsner with a malty backbone and a hint of hops.
name: Golden Lager

brewers_tips: Age for several months to allow the flavors to mellow and develop.
description: A strong and complex Belgian quadrupel with notes of dark fruit, caramel, and spice.
name: Abbey's Blessing

brewers_tips: Maintain a cool fermentation temperature to preserve the delicate hop character.
description: A light and sessionable American pale ale with a pronounced citrusy aroma.
name: West Coast Pale Ale

brewers_tips: Be sure to use a strong enough yeast strain to ferment the high alcohol content.
description: A warming and boozy barleywine with notes of toffee, caramel, and dried fruit.
name: Winter warmer Barleywine
tagline: A beer to chase away the cold

brewers_tips: Add a generous amount of flaked oats for a smooth and creamy mouthfeel.
description: A hazy and refreshing milk stout with notes of chocolate, coffee, and lactose sugar.
name: Midnight Moo Milk Stout

brewers_tips: Use a blend of German and Czech pilsner malts for an authentic flavor profile.
description: A light and crisp Kölsch-style ale with a hint of sweetness and a subtle hoppy bitterness.
name: Cologne Calling Kölsch
tagline: A taste of Cologne in every sip

brewers_tips: Sour mash the wort to create a tart and acidic flavor profile.
description: A tart and refreshing Berliner Weisse with a hint of fruit flavor.
name: Berlin's Bite Berliner Weisse

brewers_tips: Experiment with different wood chips to achieve the desired smoke character.
description: A smoky and malty rauchbier with a hint of chocolate and caramel.
name: Smoky Mountain Rauchbier

brewers_tips: Dry hop with citrusy hops for a bright and refreshing aroma.
description: A sessionable and citrusy American IPA with a moderate bitterness.
name: West Coast Crush IPA

brewers_tips: Use a blend of Belgian yeasts for a complex flavor profile.
description: A strong and spicy Belgian tripel with notes of pear, banana, and pepper.
name: Abbey's Fury Tripel

brewers_tips: Control fermentation temperature carefully to maintain a clean and crisp flavor.
description: A light and refreshing German-style pilsner with a pronounced bitterness.
name: Munich's Finest Pilsner

brewers_tips: Age for several months in oak barrels to add complexity and character.
description: A strong and complex English barleywine with notes of oak, vanilla, and dried fruit.
name: Cellar Dweller Barleywine

brewers_tips: Use a blend of wheat and barley malt for a smooth and full-bodied beer.
description: A light and refreshing American wheat beer with a hint of citrus and spice.
name: Summer Citrus Wheat
tagline: A taste of sunshine in a glass

brewers_tips: Mash at a higher temperature to accentuate the malt character.
description: A rich and toasty English brown ale with notes of caramel, toffee, and nuts.
name: Nutty Brown Ale
